definition: no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: At the heart of Afghanistan is an empty space a striking absence where the larger of the colossal Bamian Buddhas once stood.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗的腹地是一块空旷之地，人烟稀少。

sentences.english: Hanging out with little friends to some desolated places.
sentences.chinese: 和一两个朋友去人烟稀少的地方。

sentences.english: The snow and sleet made people stay away from the Bund and the cruises.
sentences.chinese: 雨夹雪使得外滩和游船上人烟稀少。

sentences.english: The richly endowed but underpopulated ivory coast.
sentences.chinese: 肥沃富饶但人烟稀少的象牙海岸。

sentences.english: Again the land is flat; the countryside sparsely populated.
sentences.chinese: 这一段又是平原地带，乡村里人烟稀少。

definition: lit. men's footprints are rare (idiom)/fig. off the beaten track/lonely/deserted
dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken
left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
lit. barren hills and wild rivers (idiom)/fig. inhospitable natural environment
